article_title: 5 Charts From the Week in Markets
article_text:
Oil slumped anew and metals prices hit fresh lows this week, signaling mounting investor concern about the pace of global growth and commodities’ value as an investment class. Copper and silver, both used in electronics, sank to six-year lows. Gold fell to a five-year low and U.S. oil entered a bear market, prompting Goldman Sachs, for one, to predict prices would drop below $1,000a troy ounce for the first time in more than six years.

The slide was echoed across commodity markets, witinvestors braced for a stronger dollar amid signals from the Federal Reserve of a U.S. rate increase this year.

twitter.description: Investors ditch commodities, a winning bet on Obamacare, Wall Street prepares for panic on Main Street, and the world's most valuable bank.
twitter.title: 5 Charts From the Week in Markets
